description: ProxyDefaultsSpec defines the desired state of ProxyDefaults.

accessLogs.description: AccessLogs controls all envoy instances' access logging configuration.

disableListenerLogs.description: DisableListenerLogs turns off just listener logs for connections rejected by Envoy because they don't have a matching listener filter.

enabled.description: Enabled turns on all access logging

jsonFormat.description: JSONFormat is a JSON-formatted string of an Envoy access log format dictionary. See for more info on formatting: https://www.envoyproxy.io/docs/envoy/latest/configuration/observability/access_log/usage#format-dictionaries Defining JSONFormat and TextFormat is invalid.

path.description: Path is the output file to write logs for file-type logging

textFormat.description: TextFormat is a representation of Envoy access logs format. See for more info on formatting: https://www.envoyproxy.io/docs/envoy/latest/configuration/observability/access_log/usage#format-strings Defining JSONFormat and TextFormat is invalid.

type.description: Type selects the output for logs one of "file", "stderr". "stdout"

config.description: Config is an arbitrary map of configuration values used by Connect proxies. Any values that your proxy allows can be configured globally here. Supports JSON config values. See https://www.consul.io/docs/connect/proxies/envoy#configuration-formatting

envoyExtensions.description: EnvoyExtensions are a list of extensions to modify Envoy proxy configuration.

items.description: EnvoyExtension has configuration for an extension that patches Envoy resources.

expose.description: Expose controls the default expose path configuration for Envoy.

checks.description: Checks defines whether paths associated with Consul checks will be exposed. This flag triggers exposing all HTTP and GRPC check paths registered for the service.

paths.description: Paths is the list of paths exposed through the proxy.

listenerPort.description: ListenerPort defines the port of the proxy's listener for exposed paths.

localPathPort.description: LocalPathPort is the port that the service is listening on for the given path.

path.description: Path is the path to expose through the proxy, ie. "/metrics".

protocol.description: Protocol describes the upstream's service protocol. Valid values are "http" and "http2", defaults to "http".

meshGateway.description: MeshGateway controls the default mesh gateway configuration for this service.

mode.description: Mode is the mode that should be used for the upstream connection. One of none, local, or remote.

Mode can be one of "direct" or "transparent". "transparent" represents that inbound and outbound application traffic is being captured and redirected through the proxy. This mode does not enable the traffic redirection itself. Instead it signals Consul to configure Envoy as if traffic is already being redirected. "direct" represents that the proxy's listeners must be dialed directly by the local application and other proxies. Note: This cannot be set using the CRD and should be set using annotations on the services that are part of the mesh.

transparentProxy.description: TransparentProxy controls configuration specific to proxies in transparent mode. Note: This cannot be set using the CRD and should be set using annotations on the services that are part of the mesh.

dialedDirectly.description: DialedDirectly indicates whether transparent proxies can dial this proxy instance directly. The discovery chain is not considered when dialing a service instance directly. This setting is useful when addressing stateful services, such as a database cluster with a leader node.

outboundListenerPort.description: OutboundListenerPort is the port of the listener where outbound application traffic is being redirected to.

title: Proxy Defaults
